item.title: Second Post
item.author: Daniel
item.description: When starting a blog Last time I truly hosted a public site was in the early 2010s when learning about the new trend of responsive web design with the growth of mobile web browsing. Between then and now Why a static website Why static websit GitHub Actions Although I’ve setup pipelines on AWS

item.title: About
item.author: Daniel
item.description: Hi there, I’m Daniel ðŸ‘‹ I am an engineer located in Toronto, Canada. This page is to share my work, personal learning, interests and random facts. I currently work as cloud engineer at a financial services company details on Linkedin. for My Journey The idea of learning in public peaked my interest since I’ve always been dabbling and trying new things and taking notes so this helps to formalize and share them.

item.title: Intro
item.author: Daniel
item.description: Intro This is a personal page that I created to try my hand at blogging and technical writing. I’m hoping to share share my experiences, side projects in tech that I’ve found fun and interesting. Aside from sharing my findings but also sharing as documentation for my current setups. My first set of posts will focus on the upgrades to my home lab infrastructure setup and current learnings. Influence for this page also comes from the Cloud Resume challenge, although I’ve created pages for internal clients during my day job.
